derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the adjectival sense 'close, similar': from late Latin approximatus, past participle of approximare, from ad- 'to' + proximus 'very near'. The verb (originally 'meaning bring close') arose in the mid 17th cent.; the current adjectival sense dates from the early 19th cent

entry.def: An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.

example.ex: The approximate cost varies from around £150 to £250...
example.tran: 费用大概介于150至250英镑之间。

entry.def: An idea or description that is approximate is not intended to be precise or accurate, but to give some indication of what something is like.

example.ex: They did not have even an approximate idea what the Germans really wanted.
example.tran: 他们完全不清楚德国人真正想要什么。

entry.def: If something approximates to something else, it is similar to it but is not exactly the same.

example.ex: Something approximating to a fair outcome will be ensured...
example.tran: 保证会有大致公正的结果。

example.ex: By about 6 weeks of age, most babies begin to show something approximating a day/night sleeping pattern.
example.tran: 到6个星期大时，大多数婴儿开始表现出近似于日夜分明的睡觉模式。

means.word_mean: 2. judge tentatively or form an estimate of (quantities or time);

sentences.sentence: "I estimate this chicken to weigh three pounds"
"approximate leaves grow together but are not united"

stems_affixes.word_buile: proxim接近,靠近+ity表名词→n.接近,附近
ap不断+proxim接近,靠近+ate表动词→v.[to]接近

sentences.en: The approximate date of his departure is next month.
Your story approximates to the real facts.
sentences.cn: 你所说的仅仅是接近事实真相。

sentences.en: His income approximated 8000 dollars a year.

jushi.english: We approximated the distance as three miles.
jushi.chinese: 我们粗略估计距离为三英里。
约翰的成绩接近于冠军的纪录。

jushi.english: Student numbers this year are expected to approximate 5000.
jushi.chinese: 今年的学生人数预计是5000人左右。
